arm_group.description: Patient with patent radial artery after the percutaneous coronary procedure
Patients with occluded radial artery after the procedure

brief_summary.textblock:
Transradial coronary procedures are gaining in popularity worldwide. A possible complication
      of transradial approach is the occlusion of the radial artery that in most cases is
      asymptomatic. However the investigators do not know if the radial artery occlusion may
      impact over the muscle force of the hand or fingers.

      To evaluate if transradial approach for percutaneous coronary procedures may affect muscle
      force of the hand, thumb and index finger the investigators use a standardized hand-grip
      manometer and a pinch gauge before the transradial procedure, the day after the procedures
      and after few months.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hand Grip Test and Transradial Coronary Procedures

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Stable patients who undergo elective percutaneous transradial coronary procedures

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  hemodynamic instability,

          -  acute coronary syndromes,

          -  haemodialysis patients with an arteriovenous fistula,

          -  sheath diameter > 6 French,

          -  age < 18 years

study_pop.textblock: Stable patients who undergo elective percutaneous transradial coronary procedures

clinical_study.official_title: Hand Grip Test After Transradial Percutaneous Coronary Procedures

primary_outcome.description: The variation in had grip strength and thumb pinch after the procedure (the day after and at 30 day follow-up) compared to baseline in patients with patent radial artery compared to occluded radial artery.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of radial occlusion after transradial coronary procedures

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
